trans-unit.source: Extends design-time behavior for controls that implement the methods of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl"></xref> abstract class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner> can be used with other control types that implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.INamingContainer> interface.
Otherwise <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner> functions similarly to its base class, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner"></xref> class.
Creates the child controls of this <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner.CreateChildControls%2A> method is used to recreate the child controls in the associated control.
It ensures that the control collection is created before creating the design-time markup.
Gets the HTML that is used to represent the control at design time.
For more information about the overloads available for this method see <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner>.
In this overridden method, the base implementation always creates the child controls on the associated control.
The HTML that is used to represent the control at design time.
Initializes the designer with the specified <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> object.
The designer host calls <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.CompositeControlDesigner.Initialize%2A> to initialize the component for design.
The base implementation will throw an exception if the associated control does not implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.INamingContainer> interface.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref>, which is the control associated with this designer.
